title: Charm Person

Level 1 Enchantment Spell

Charm a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain Advantage on Charisma Checks in dialogue.

Enemies have Advantage on Saving Throws against being Charmed.

Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target. In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them.

Charm person is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Charm person is a Lvl 1 Spell from the Enchantment school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Charm Person Information

Description: Charm a humanoid to prevent it from attacking you. You gain Advantage on Charisma Checks in dialogue. Enemies have Advantage on Saving Throws against being Charmed When the spell ends, the target might accuse you of Charming them. Condition ends early if you or an ally hurts the target. In higher difficulty modes, the target might accuse you of enchanting them. Level: Lvl 1 spell School: Enchantment Casting Time: Action Range: 18m/30ft Requires Concentration: No Saving Throw: Wisdom Additional Details: None

Charmed (Condition)

Duration: 10 Turns

Can't attack spellcaster. Spellcaster has advantage on all checks in dialogues.

How to Acquire Charm Person

Charm person can be acquired by the following classes:

Charm Person Tips & Notes

Differences from D&D 5th Edition:

Duration is 1 hour, which equates to 600 Turns. Range is only 30ft. In combat, hostile creatures have advantage on their saving throw.
